result.execSummary:
The defendant Lanessa Latosha Goforth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lanessa Latosha Goforth is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lanessa Latosha Goforth was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall serve 10 days in the Lafayette County Jail.
Defendant is eligible for good time calculation.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the sentence ordered in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CM-92.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lanessa Latosha Goforth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Case called at 1:39 PM.
Defendant Lanessa Latosha Goforth in court with attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is resolved.
Defendant withdrawals plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enters a plea of "NO CONTEST" to Count 2.
Court questions defendant and counsel re: plea and waiver of rights.
Factual basis is found.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" 
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties, attorney Diaz - Martinez concurs with the state.
Court grants motion of the parties and orders defendant to the Lafayette County Jail with good time calculation (12/02/2016 report date).
Court costs are waived in this matter 
Consecutive to the sentence ordered in Laf. Co. Court Case No. 15-CM-92.
Status conference on November 23, 2016 at 11:30 am.
